application

Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.GameController

  • public class GameController
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    1.0.0 Build 1 November 20, 2020.

    Program GameController Description


    Usage :% java GameController

    This program manipulates the Game screen of the Market Madness application. It serves as initialization to the game as well as create a Bankruptcy button, progresses the stock graph, calls the buy and sell stock methods from PlayerData, and sends the user to the result screen once the game has ended.

    ALGORITHM:

    The textMap holds all text elements of the Game.fxml file
    The buttonMap holds all button elements of the Game.fxml file

    initialize()
    Fills the textMap and buttonMap with String references to their respective Text and Button variables
    It does this through declaring a Name array of Strings and an array of Text/button elements
    After both these maps are filled, the GraphMaster class is called to start the game
    Once the stocks are loaded with GraphMaster.GameStart(), we will have to call paintGraph to display the starting values of the graphs
    Style
    Add all text to Text Map
    Add all buttons to Button Map

    Bankruptcy()
    Essentially a quit button
    In the event a game becomes unwinnable, the user can decide to return to the main menu via this method

    paintGraph()
    Used to progress the graph and display the next days information

    EndScreen()
    Called once the game has ended and the user has no choice other than to continue to the results screen
    The method loads the ResultScreen.fxml, as well as passes the players 'score' to initializeResults
    Put 'css' file for results screen here, if at all needed

    BuyStock()
    Parses a portion of the button that calls its name to extract the name of the stock (i.e. "RedBuy" will be parsed to "Red", and passed to the PlayerData.BuyStock method)

    SellStock()
    Parses a portion of the button that calls its name to extract the name of the stock (i.e. "RedSell" will be parsed to "Red", and passed to the PlayerData.SellStock method)
    Author:
    Paul O'Bar, Julian Negrete, Gideon Reyes, Tinesha Johnson, Stephen Otten

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize()
        The initialize method fills the textMap and buttonMap with String references to their respected Text and Button variables. It does this through declaring a Name array of Strings and an array of Text/button elements. After both these maps are filled, the GraphMaster class is called to start the game. Once the stocks are loaded with GraphMaster.GameStart() we will have to call paintGraph to display the starting values of the graphs.
        See Also:
        GraphMaster.GameStart();, paintGraph();

      • Bankruptcy

        void Bankruptcy(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
         throws java.io.IOException
        The Bankruptcy method is essentially a quit button. In the event a game becomes unwinnable the user can decide to return to the main menu via this method.
        Parameters:
        event -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • paintGraph

        void paintGraph()
        The paintGraph method is used to progress the graph and display the next days information.

      • EndScreen

        void EndScreen(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        throws java.io.IOException
        The EndScreen method is called once the game has ended and the user has no choice other than to continue to the results screen. The method Loads the ResultScreen.fxml, As well as passes the players 'score' to initializeResults
        Parameters:
        event -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        getUserController.initializeResults();

      • BuyStock

        void BuyStock(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        The BuyStock method parses a portion of the button that call to its' name to extract the name of the stock ie "RedBuy" will be parsed to "Red", and passed to the PlayerData.BuyStock method.
        Parameters:
        event - must be a button named {STOCKNAME}Buy
        See Also:
        PlayerData.BuyStock();

      • SellStock

        void SellStock(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        The SellStock method parses a portion of the button that call to its' name to extract the name of the stock ie "RedSell" will be parsed to "Red", and passed to the PlayerData.SellStock method.
        Parameters:
        event - must be a button named {STOCKNAME}Sell
        See Also:
        PlayerData.SellStock();
